1115763828057235456.text: Check out how Polaris has tracked the market since its launch here: https://marbleprotocol.github.io/polaris-graph/ pic.twitter.com/ShWOs8hRLy

1110922644201721856.text: We’re excited to gather feedback and test Polaris on the Ethereum mainnet before any live systems depend on it. If you’re building a protocol that could use a trustless on-chain oracle, please let us know!

1110922643434168320.text: The challenge is to balance competing priorities of an ideal oracle system: a live price, low work costs, and high resistance to price manipulation. Future versions of Polaris can improve on each of these.

1110922642809192448.text: Polaris attempts to solve the price manipulation problem. To do this, it creates a market between protocols who pay to have access to an accurate price and workers who pay to checkpoint the price on Uniswap over time, making an attack difficult and costly.

1110922642188455941.text: We chose Uniswap as a starting point because it always has an on-chain price, it’s an open protocol, and it’s quickly adding liquidity because it has incentives for market makers.

1110922641546702849.text: We looked into existing solutions. Most are centralized. Augur and DutchX are potentially good, but too slow. Several on-chain exchanges have accurate prices but are easy to manipulate.

1110922640980508673.text: There are lots of use cases for a fair on-chain price oracle: lending, derivatives, synthetic assets, portfolio management. @marbleprotocol needs one for lending.

1110922640401678337.text: We just released Polaris, a trustless price oracle built on @UniswapExchange:https://medium.com/@mykelp/introducing-polaris-ced195dd798e …

1082441073249546241.text: I just published "Compound's Self-Liquidation Bug" about the issue discovered in @compoundfinance a few weeks ago. https://medium.com/@richmcateer_93513/compounds-self-liquidation-bug-829d6571c2df …

1037851354172018688.text: This is a good primer on token curated registries. The only use cases I can think of for TCRs that might be valuable today are ones in which the list is used by smart contracts: identity, token tickers, 0x asset proxies, for example.https://multicoin.capital/2018/09/05/tcrs-features-and-tradeoffs/ …
